ProjectTitle: Mary at the Margins: Constructing a Liberative Marian Theology
InitialFeedbackHistory: 15/03/2024 [REDACTED] already made a good start for your DMP but it misses some important information that will need to be added as the research progresses: 1) [REDACTED] data summary: the data description table is too short. [REDACTED] ethnography you will probably work with different types of data besides the transcription files, e.g.: audio recordings of interviews, transcription files of the interviews, observational data: physical and digital field notes, maybe pictures and images taken during fieldwork, and so on. [REDACTED] can organize this based on the fieldwork in the three different locations: [REDACTED] [REDACTED] US. 2) [REDACTED] & [REDACTED] are crucial to make your data findable, understandable and reusable. [REDACTED] will be very important to organize and document your ethnographic fieldwork well, especially since you work with sensitive data, in three different locations. [REDACTED] of important documentation & metadata for your research project: a good folder structure, clear file names, methodology information, a codebook explaining the meaning of your codes for the analysis of the interviews, a logbook for your fieldwork, adding structure to your fieldnotes, README files explaining the content of certain folders, ... [REDACTED] you use a [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] software like for example NVivo? [REDACTED] can also mention this here. [REDACTED] more guidance: https://www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/guidance/documentation-metadata 3) [REDACTED] storage: [REDACTED] to enable the multifactor authentication (https://admin.kuleuven.be/icts/english/MFA/MFA) 4) [REDACTED] preservation: OneDrive is not suitable for long term preservation since it is a personal storage and linked to your KU [REDACTED] employment. [REDACTED] can archive your data on a long term storage infrastructure at KU [REDACTED] (for example an archived folder on the shared drive or a folder on the archival [REDACTED] for more options consult the storage guide: https://icts.kuleuven.be/storagewijzer/en and/or your local IT team) OR on a trusted data repository like KU [REDACTED] RDR (https://www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/rdr). 5) [REDACTED] sharing: consider sharing the pseudonymized interview transcripts in KU [REDACTED] RDR (rdr.kuleuven.be) in restricted access. [REDACTED] access means that researchers who want access to your data will need to send a motivated request. [REDACTED] the motivated request is approved a [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] will be set up protecting your data. [REDACTED] more information: https://www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/rdr/custom-kuleuven 6) [REDACTED] [REDACTED] will be responsible for day-to-day data management, whilst your supervisor will likely be responsible for overall data management, especially in the long term. 15/03/2024 [REDACTED] already made a good start for your DMP but it misses some important information that will need to be added as the research progresses: 1) [REDACTED] data summary: the data description table is too short.
